question: Which of the following is a correct definition of “Isohyets”?
option1: Lines on a map showing equal rainfall
option2: Lines on a map having same mean temperature
option3: Lines on a map having same barometric pressure
option4: Lines on a map showing equal height from mean sea level
answer: Lines on a map showing equal rainfall
explanation: An isohyet may be defined as a line joining points of equal rainfall. In other words, a line drawn on a map connecting points that receive equal amounts of rainfall is known as Isohyte.
